str2: And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
Three. Or neuter tria a primary number; 'three'.
A (lunar) month. A primary word; a month.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
A plot, design against. From a presumed compound of epi and boulomai; a plan against someone, i.e. A plot.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: From ana and ago; to lead up; by extension to bring out; specially, to sail away.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Syria, a great Roman imperial province, united with Cilicia. Probably of Hebrew origin; Syria, a region of Asia.
Opinion, counsel, judgment, intention, decree. From ginosko; cognition, i.e. opinion, or resolve.
To turn back, return. From hupo and strepho; to turn under, i.e. To return.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
(Hebrew), Macedonia, a Roman province north of Achaia (Greece). From Makedon; Macedonia, a region of Greece.
